content: Always validate AI-generated code — it writes fast, but doesn’t always write right.
When prompting an AI, describe the *context*, not just the task.
Never copy-paste AI code directly into production. Ever.
Use AI for boilerplate, but keep logic and architecture human-driven.
Break big prompts into smaller steps — AI thinks better interactively.
If the AI sounds overly confident, triple-check the result.
Treat AI like an intern: helpful, fast, sometimes wrong.
Use AI to explain unfamiliar code — even your own from last year.
AI can draft documentation, but you must verify accuracy.
Use AI diff reviewers to catch mistakes when you’re tired.
